decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while using cards like Ruin Crab, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, and Soaring Thought-Thief to mill the opponent's deck. The main goal is to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and controlling the board with counterspells and removal spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds a recurring threat to the deck and provides additional value throughout the game. This deck aims to grind out victories by outlasting the opponent and overwhelming them with card advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad to enhance the Aggro strategy of the Azorius archetype. By incorporating multiple blink effects and powerful creatures like Dream Trawler and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a consistent stream of threats and disruption. The inclusion of supportive cards like Glass Casket and Elspeth Conquers Death helps maintain board control while generating card advantage. The deck's mana base is optimized to support the high curve and multiple colors, allowing for flexibility and resilience in a 1 vs 1 format.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies through counter spells, targeted removal, and mill effects. The deck utilizes cards like Mystical Dispute and Drown in the Loch to control the board, while also using cards like Ruin Crab and Into the Story to mill opponent's deck. Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief can pressure opponents while also fueling graveyard strategies. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by controlling the game and ultimately winning through card advantage and milling out the opponent's deck.

Focused on disrupting opponents and controlling the board, this deck aims to stall the game with removal spells and counter magic while digging through the deck for key cards. Using Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck utilizes various graveyard interactions and a mix of creatures and spells to maintain control over the game. It wins by outvaluing opponents and grinding them down with its efficient removal and card advantage. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while assembling its own win conditions.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful control elements such as Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Shatterskull Smashing to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Cultivate to cast high-impact spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Terror of the Peaks. The inclusion of various creatures like Beanstalk Giant and Kazandu Mammoth provides additional threats and versatility. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while ramping up and overwhelming the opponent with big plays.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to establish board presence quickly with efficient creatures like Gilded Goose and Wicked Wolf, while also utilizing cards like Skyclave Apparition and Elspeth Conquers Death to control the opponent's board. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Charming Prince and Trail of Crumbs, and has a late-game strategy with Yorion, Sky Nomad flickering the board for additional value. The inclusion of ramp cards like Llanowar Visionary and Emeria's Call helps ensure a smooth mana curve and the ability to play powerful spells like The Great Henge and Kogla, the Titan Ape.

This deck focuses on using mill strategies to control the opponent's deck size and leverage cards that benefit from opponents having a large graveyard. By utilizing cards like Ruin Crab, Drown in the Loch, and Into the Story, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building board presence with creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds a powerful recursion element to the deck, allowing for repeated use of key cards.

The deck focuses on utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to maximize value from blinking creatures and permanents for additional ETB effects. It includes a mix of control elements like counter spells and board wipes (Shatter the Sky) along with efficient threats like Skyclave Apparition and Dream Trawler. The deck also includes various card draw and filtering tools to ensure consistency. The mana base is designed to support the Azorius colors and enable the activation of Emeria's Call for a late-game win condition.

The deck focuses on using cycling cards to quickly draw through the deck, while leveraging the cycling synergies with cards like Zenith Flare and Footfall Crater to deal damage and close out the game. Drannith Stinger and Flourishing Fox are key pieces to build up a board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to be fast and efficient in dealing damage, utilizing the versatility of cycling cards to maximize its aggro potential. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the deck to recast key cycling cards from the graveyard.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage in order to stall and control the board until it can win with a powerful combo involving Transmogrify. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as both a companion and a way to reset key permanents, while Dream Trawler provides a strong win condition. The deck also includes various enchantments and artifacts for additional removal and card advantage, along with a suite of lands to ensure consistent mana. The goal is to outlast and out-value the opponent until victory is assured.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing efficient creatures like Gilded Goose and Wicked Wolf, along with powerful support cards such as Skyclave Apparition and The Great Henge, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. With cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Emeria's Call, the deck also has the ability to provide additional value and maintain momentum throughout the match.

This Naya Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Cultivate, Lotus Cobra, and Wolfwillow Haven to cast powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Phylath, World Sculptor. The deck also includes cards like Felidar Retreat and Bala Ged Recovery to provide additional value and flexibility in controlling the game. With Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, this deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm opponents with big creatures and powerful spells.

The key strategy of this Naya Control deck is to use powerful cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Felidar Retreat to control the board and generate card advantage. By ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Lotus Cobra, the deck aims to cast massive threats like Phylath, World Sculptor and close out the game with a swarm of tokens from Felidar Retreat. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion for additional value. With a focus on controlling the game while ramping up mana, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The main objective of this Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to aggressively attack the opponent and deal damage quickly. By using efficient creatures like Anax, Hardened in the Forge and Bonecrusher Giant, along with powerful combat tricks such as Embercleave and Shatterskull Smashing, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Robber of the Rich and Phoenix of Ash provides additional reach and card advantage, while cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Castle Embereth help increase the deck's damage output.

This mono green aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with powerful creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Questing Beast, and Yorvo, Lord of Garenbrig. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with creatures that have trample and other powerful abilities while also utilizing cards like Garruk, Unleashed and The Great Henge for additional value and card advantage. The deck includes ramp spells like Turntimber Symbiosis and mana sinks like Crawling Barrens to ensure it can keep up the pressure and finish off the opponent quickly.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's strategies and maintain board control. It includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win the game through attrition. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Ashiok, Nightmare Muse and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to close out the game once it has control of the board. Overall, the deck aims to grind out wins by efficiently answering threats and overwhelming the opponent with card advantage.
